passages.text: China (PRC) | Autos & Auto Parts

Tuopu reported 2Q25 results with revenue of RMB7.2bn, up \(10\%\) YoY, and earnings of RMB729mn, down \(10\%\) YoY. 2Q25 GPM came in at \(19.3\%\) down \(0.6 / 1.1\) ppt QoQ/YoY, duemainly to pricing pressure from OEMs and rising depreciation cost. We joined Tuopu's post- result group call, where mgmt shared their thoughts on liquid cooling business and humanoid robot development. The company aims to achieve \(20\%\) YoY revenue growth next year. Details below.

2Q results came in line with core business still under pressure. Tuopu reported 2Q25 results with revenue of RMB7.2bn, up \(10\%\) YoY, and earnings of RMB729mn, down \(10\%\) YoY, in line with our expectations. The soft result was mainly attributed to the weak sales momentum of Tesla (especially Cybertruck model), persistent pricing pressure from OEMs as well as rising depreciation cost (we estimate the D&A cost to revenue ratio rose to c. \(7\%\) in 1H25, up 1ppt YoY). Looking ahead, however, mgmt remained positive and expect to achieve double- digit growth from 3Q25 through 2030, supported by contributions from Xiaomi, Seres and Geely. In 2025, the company targets RMB30bn revenue and \(20\%\) YoY growth in 2026.

Overseas expansion. Tuopu believes overseas markets, mainly Europe and US, will be one of its key growth drivers going forward. Major overseas customers include legacy OEMs including Ford, GM, Stellantis, Volkswagen, BMW and Mercedes, and EV players such as Rivian and Lucid. Key products are lightweight chassis parts and air suspension systems. In terms of capacity, 1) Poland factory is planning a second phase given increasing order demand from Mercedes and BMW, 2) Thailand plant is primarily planned for humanoid robots, while also supporting the local expansion of Chinese OEMs such as BYD and Chery.

Updates on humanoid robots. Management noted that the current production of humanoid robot actuators remains inefficient due to the wide variety of specifications (48 in total) and the lack of full automation on the production lines. The company expects to start receiving orders for the next- generation Optimus in 1Q26. Additionally, Tuopu shared that its robotics team has grown to 138 members, with an annual R&D investment of c. RMB100mn.

Expanding into liquid cooling business. The company sees strong potential in leveraging its existing supply chain and industry know- how to transition from automotive thermal management to fluid cooling solutions for AI data centers. Core products include cooling plates and CD components. Moreover, according to mgmt, the company is actively engaging with overseas clients such as NVIDIA, Meta, and Google, as well as domestic customers such as Huawei. Tuopu suggested its liquid cooling order backlog has reached RMB1.7bn.
Maltrain Buy. We lower our rev/earnings forecasts for Tuopu in 2025- 2026 to factor in 1H25 sales and margin pressure. Maintain Buy with PT of RMB72.5 based on 35x (5- year average) 2026E PE.

Investment Thesis / Where We DifferFounded in 1983, Tuopu has evolved from a leading NVH supplier to a tier- 0.5 supplier covering various auto components which we attribute to mgmt's strategic vision. The expanding client base/market share (Tesla, BYD, Li Auto, AITO) together with the rising content value per vehicle (from RMB1k to RMB20k) support Tuopu's solid growth ahead. Meanwhile, leveraging the moat in the auto industry, the company is moving into the humanoid robot industry which we expect to create another growth driver in the future.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
Base Case, CNY72.5, +16%
We value Tuopu based on 35x 2026E P/E, giving us a PT of Rmb72.5/share.
Upside Scenario, CNY82.9, +32%
Our bull case of Rmb82.9/sh is based on 40x 2026E P/E.
Downside Scenario, CNY31.1, - 50%
Our bear case of Rmb31.1/sh is based on 15x 2026E P/E.

1. Emission management: In routine work and operations, Tuopu needs to pay attention to energy conservation and consumption reduction and create environment-friendly conditions in production.  
2. Data security is a vital ESG issue. Tuopu should comply with related regulations and actively conduct internal training for privacy protection.
1. Achieve carbon peak by 2030 and carbon neutrality by 2060 alongside China's decarbonize goal.

1. How do you motivate employee innovation?  
2. How much have you invested in energy consumption reduction in production?

Ningbo Tuopu Group Co., Ltd. is a multipurpose enterprise specializing in R&D, manufacturing, and sales of auto parts. The company produces vibration- control mechanisms, molding, suspension, and other equipment for the international auto industry.
We value Tuopu based on 35x 2026E P/E. Risks: lower- than- expected NEV sales; slower than expected development of humanoid robots.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Ningbo Tuopu Group Co Ltd-A (601689 CH: CNY62.61, BUY)

Notes: Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.

D: Dropped Coverage
